physicalDescription.note: On envelope: "#1092 JCRS Patients and Nurses c. 1920" On back of photograph: "Mr. Frenburg & wife, Miss Hume nurse, #1092."

mods.abstract: Dr. Frenburg stands between his wife and Miss Hume. The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish workingmen along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. It was located on West Colfax Avenue just outside Denver.
